Clever.effect: Immune to Blackmailed, Disabled and Despaired.

Self-Defence.effect: You are protected from attacks. If someone attacks you, you will inflict them with blackmailed and you find out their name & role.

Fishing Buddies.effect: For every 2 Allies of the same alignment you have, gain an extra item during item rains.

Barrels.effect: You get an extra 4 inventory spaces.

Confidence.effect: Once you've killed someone not your alignment, you become immune to negative status effects.

Ignorant.effect: Cannot be redirected to another target when you attack somebody.

Justice's Gift.effect: If you kill someone in the opposite alignment, you will obtain an Unreliable Wish and any AAs, items and money they had.

Heroic Power.effect: You get x1.25 higher Immunity Card chances and +3 Luck if everyone in your alliance is not the opposite alignment.

Legion.effect: You may have 1 additional person in your alliance, should you choose to allow it.

Guilded.effect: Every immunity card you get, increase the immunity card chances by 2.5%. This is added after other chance effects. Hero can get bonuses in an alliance alone.

Regenerative.effect: If inflicted with a neg status, gain immunity to it after its gone. If attacked & survived, blocked, or redirected, develop immunity to that interaction - all immunities develop EOD.

Multi-Headed Stare-Down.effect: If you perform multiple actions, you can have them all register as 1 visit, even to multiple people. Action will register as the most convenient type used.

Rejuvenative Aura.effect: Allies that lose a neg status will develop immunity to it. You may toggle this per ally.

Head Growing.effect: Each time you/ally gain an immunity, and/or a new day starts, gain a base ability charge [Max 5 per day from immunities]. VR costs 2 per charge, Head-Shield max 2 per day

Justice.effect: If both people eliminated during the Lawful trial are not your alignment then you gain a random Epic-Mythical tier item.

Dystopia.effect: If both of the people eliminated are your alignment during the Lawful trial then your abilities and alignment AA's are disabled, and you get Despaired.

Golden Gavel.effect: If you vote on the eliminated player, gain +1 luck. If successful in a row, gain +1 luck per streak eliminations.

Tradesman.effect: Your luck goes up by 1 every time you receive an item from a player and down by 1 when you give an item.

Money Transfer.effect: Allows you to transfer an amount of coins to anyone within your alliance. Anyone in the Manager's alliance can also transfer money to allies. Manager can turn this on or off.

Enhanced Learning.effect: Each time your base abilities are successfully used, gain 1 luck and 5% coins.

Lock On.effect: Redirections will work on you, but also inflict your original target and redirection users with the ability/item as well.

Loadout Change.effect: At any point, you may choose to add a charge to Entrapment or Smoke Grenade. You have 5 charges. This cannot be copied.

Service.effect: If you save anyone with Preserve, they cannot vote you for the rest of the game.

Haunted Tombstone.effect: Cut a player of your choices coins in half when you're eliminated, you choose who gets the coins. Corpses are not removed from alliance chat and still count for luck, coins and IC - they may talk in alliance chat if permitted by Medium. Medium can remove dead members from alliance.

Spiritual.effect: You can open chats with the dead, allowing communication.

Medical Bills.effect: You may charge your target an amount of coins when using any of your base abilities on somebody. If they refuse the bills, you will get your ability charge back.

Cleansing Aura.effect: Negative statuses on yourself and allies are degraded to not be as effective. Can be toggled on/off per ally.

Angelic.effect: Positives inflicted by you on others will reward you with 200 coins. Positives inflicted on you will reward the inflictor with 100 coins, provided its not you.

Golden Thread.effect: If you are killed from an attack, your death is delayed for 24 hours, multiple attacks will all strike at the 24h mark. Elimination does not count towards this, except Soul-Bound or Finale. These attacks are treated like a visit and effect at the 24h mark, but have no origin.

Hourglass of Life.effect: Every time an ally dies, or you're alone for an elimination, gain 1 regret.

Heartbeats.effect: Immune to all negative statuses, but every time you gain a regret, lose an immunity of choice.

Spiritual Remains.effect: While without regrets, your vote has +2 power. This perk does not stack with itself.

Shaking Hands.effect: While having less than 3 regrets, you cannot be redirected.

Shallow Breaths.effect: While with less than 4 regrets, if an ally or yourself is attacked, you can choose to kill the attacker, or stop them, paralysing and despairing them. Killing them will add a regret to yourself, but not killing them will remove a regret from yourself.

Level Headed.effect: While with less than 6 regrets, you will remove a negative status from yourself or an ally of choice every day.

Timelines.effect: You can choose with up to a 12 hour delay, when a status placed on you begins effecting you.
Timelines.additionalInfo: You only learn the type of status (including curse vs death curse), not what variant it is (Wizard freeze vs freeze, Ghost death curse vs death curse) before it effects you.

Time Zoned.effect: If your ability is reflected back onto you, or fails, you can re-use it. This cannot be copied.

Exposed.effect: If three currently living people have declared you as the Undercover, you cannot use Deduct or Investigate anymore. If someone incorrectly declares, find out who they are, and you may reduce their coin bonus to 0% and inflict a negative [not DC] status of choice, at any point once per incorrect guess.

White Clues.effect: Gain a charge for Investigate every time you deduce an opposite aligned person.

Magic Barrier.effect: Immune to Frozen, Paralysed, Burned and Cursed. Reflects onto the inflictor.

Winter Coat.effect: You reflect Frozen, and may choose to give allies immunity to Frozen. You may also choose to remove this immunity at any time even if they left the alliance.

Nomadic.effect: You can see who is currently Frozen at any time and will be told if anyone thaws, and who caused the Frozen removal.

Icicles.effect: When any players thaw out naturally, you may choose to re-freeze them for 24 hours.

Glacial Wall.effect: If anyone attempts to vote you while they are Frozen it will not count.

Snow Globes.effect: Every time you use 2 items, you gain an Ice Wand. If an item is overused for this perk, it may be disregarded by the Host.

Eternal Hunger.effect: Every time something is used on you, gain 5% coin bonus.

Manipulator.effect: If you Decode someone and they have the Lucky status, they get the Unlucky status or vice versa. Same applies with Burned & Frozen. You can choose to turn this off.

Finger of Death.effect: When you die, you may pick a target to have the first vote for someone count as 2 permanently. Once that target dies, you may choose another player.

Counting Stars.effect: Every time one of your allies die, you gain a charge for Man's Blessing or Decode.

Bank Loans.effect: When in an alliance, all members gain x1.2 more coins. Also allows you to transfer an amount of coins to anyone. Anyone in the Banker's alliance can also transfer money to each other. Banker will know who passes what amounts to who and Banker can turn this on or off.

Greedy.effect: If in an alliance, you may take all coins that non-aligned allies get. If 50% of living player pay payday, you gain elimination immunity for next elimination, if 75% pay, also gain +2 vote power for upcoming elimination.

Shopkeeper.effect: You will know when an item is bought, and what item it is.

Bards Charisma.effect: If Bard, x2 luck and coins from all sources. If not, x1.5 coins instead of x2. Lucky does not effect coins. This perk cannot stack with itself.

Lullaby.effect: If killed, your killer will be blackmailed for 36 hours. If eliminated, all voters will be given unlucky.

On Deaf Ears.effect: You may fake-use any base abilities of yours on people.

Bomber's Mask.effect: Allows you to track the locations of your bombs, including 6 Point Bombs when held.

Cautious Nature.effect: When going to use an ability or item on someone, you will know if an ability/effect/perk is active on or around them.

Resistant Vest.effect: Immune to any effects of a bomb and any fatal item effects.

Rulebreaker.effect: Negative item effects from the alignment you currently are will not affect you.

Wilful Ignorance.effect: Your actions cannot be blocked in any way.

Perfection.effect: You're already perfect, you cant use Upgrade on yourself. Hyperdrive on yourself will give 1/2 charges when applying then to aas, and 1/3 to base abilities. Your self-hyper runs off a different timer than other hypers given to you.

Tinkering.effect: You can upgrade any Common items you obtain once per item type, and any Uncommon items you obtain once.

Robotic Nature.effect: You're immune to Paralysed, Frozen, Burned, Despaired, Blackmailed and Drunk.

Cybernetic Link.effect: Upgrades done by you become Degrades when you are killed/eliminated. If an upgraded player no longer has charges in the upgraded ability / lost the perk - their inventory is capped at 2 and loses any immunities they currently have. While there's a living player that you've upgraded or hyperdrived, you can only die to eliminations.

Lead Actor.effect: You gain 2 luck from Good&Evil, for every good & evil pair in an alliance, gain an additional 2 luck. When you leave an alliance, you may have any form of leave message come up. You can leave your own abilities.

Top-Hat Tip.effect: You start the game lucky, you are immune to unlucky. You can see yours & all your allies luck upon request (12h cooldown).

False-Smile.effect: If someone leaves your alliance, use a free charge of opening act on them for -10%, or, you can inflict unlucky, frozen or disabled within 12h, frozen & disabled will last 12h.

Forced Performance.effect: If someone uses a negative action on you that tells you it was used, if you correctly say who did it, you may drag them into your alliance at any time

Secret Spirit.effect: You can still use your items and abilities when you're eliminated. You still gain AA's and items from power drops/item rains. In addition, you act as if permanently preserved

Confusion.effect: If you're investigated, the investigator will receive a random result instead.

Rage.effect: When you or an ally is negatively afflicted, gain another charge of Bloody Knuckles. You can only gain 1 charge per person who negatively inflicts you or your allies every 2 days.

God's Fist.effect: Once Rage activates ten times gain a powerful upgrade for one use of Bloody Knuckles that strips all immunities including death immunity or protection, can't be blocked or redirected.

Crippling Strike.effect: When an ally is attacked, you will know who did it even through Shatter, and can choose to paralyze them. Status immunities you have chosen to remove with Bloody Knuckles prior to the attack will be removed permanently from the attacker.

Scrying.effect: When you use Dimensional Shatter you gain death immunity, nullify 50% of votes on you, and Crippling Strike also activates for both status infliction and attacks.

Sexual Findings.effect: Every time someone new uses something on you, gain 25 coins. Every time you use something new, gain 25 coins.

Kiss Of Death.effect: Each time an embraced dies, gain 300 coins.

Master.effect: You will be told if an embraced is voting you / going to vote you. embraced will not gain x2 votes against you, and instead will be halved in vote power. If majority of votes are going to be on you [based on if nothing was reducing vote power / redirecting votes] from embraced members mostly, you may choose to have a random one die via Soul Suck, bypassing everything, max once every 36 hours.

Utter Affection.effect: If you have 4 or more living embraced, if attacked, your latest embraced will take the hit. This also activates if 33% of living are embraced.

Hard-On.effect: If 3 embraced die, gain a charge of hair pulling, and become able to self-use gentle holdings.

Love-Hate Duet.effect: Evade the first negative from an embraced each day, you learn what it was and who did it.

Lick-Up.effect: If one of your embraced die from soul suck, you gain a random item, going up in rarity for base-level. eg, 1st kill is common+, second is uncommon+, etc.

Attachment.effect: Select a player as your host, you may change target at each day's start. You will know what action types (positive/neutral/negative and ability/item) they perform.

Mood Altering.effect: Your host cannot vote for you. If your host is voted at all, you also get 1 vote against you. For every 3rd vote, you also get voted once more.

Immunity System Breeching.effect: You may see and copy 1 immunity from your host upon picking them
Immunity System Breeching.additionalInfo: Can copy fake immunities. Will not see role immunities from Succubus, Masochist, and Undercover.

Pleasure.effect: Receive a stack of pleasure every time you get voted.

Masochism.effect: Gain 100 coins for every stack you receive.

Bliss.effect: When you're attacked, it fails and you give the attacker Blackmailed. Gives you 3 stacks. Activates at 10 stacks.

Euphoria.effect:
Gives additional perks when at high amount of stacks.
12 Stacks = You get an extra vote if you have a negative status effect.
14 Stacks = All negative status effects don't work on you apart from Cursed.
16 Stacks = You now get an extra vote for every negative status effect.
18 Stacks = You now may swap 3 stacks in for immunity to the next Elimination. Deactivates when under 18 stacks again.

Pain Chaser.effect: If someone in your alliance has a negative status happen, you get it instead.

Master Bound.effect: You cannot vote yourself or inflict yourself with negative status effects, unless reflected.

Blend In.effect: In a tie vote, only your opposition can be voted.

Personal Mimicry.effect: Upon a successful Reaction, you may copy a perk from the person. Max 2 at a time.

Shifting.effect: Your alignment will change to whatever your alliance's dominant faction is luck wise. If there's a 'tie' then you may pick between the alignments.

Stinging Serenity.effect: You may change between offensive and defensive states, with a 18 hour delay between changes. You start off in a state of choice.

Stable enough.effect:
Defensive: Immune to 3 statuses of choice
Offensive: Negative Status-inflicting items/AA last twice as long, or are twice as damaging depending on the status

Bloodied.effect:
Defensive: Every time an ally dies, your coin bonus increases by 15%
Offensive: Every time someone you have harmed dies, gain 10% of their coins

Iron-body.effect:
Defensive: Attacks will rebound and kill an ally instead
Offensive: You will block attacks against you and strike back 2 fold onto the attacker

Dead Inside.effect: Immune to any effects from somebody's perk or ability that can happen to you when they're dead.
Dead Inside.additionalInfo: This does not make you immune to effects on dead players if they were applied by an alive player (for instance, a corpse being Gas Bombed by an alive player would still hit you).

Corpse Raider.effect: Every time someone is eliminated, gain 2.5% coin bonus. Every time someone is murdered, gain 5% coin bonus.

Security.effect: Every time you successfully protect someone with Safeguard, gain a charge for Steel Guard.
upgrades: Every time you successfully protect someone with Safeguard, gain a charge for a base ability of choice.

Sympathetic.effect: Prevents anyone from voting anyone else in your alliance.
upgrades: Prevents anyone from voting you in your alliance.

Sexual Encounter.effect: Every time someone new uses something on you, gain 50 coins.

Sadistic.effect: If one of your charmed targets is voted off or killed, you gain 300 coins along with a charge for Gag.

Chain Puller.effect: If your voted target ends up in a draw, you may force all your charmed targets to vote the person of your choice. If you are voted up in a draw, you can make all charmed targets vote the other person.

Soul Sucker.effect: If a person dies from having their Soul Sucked, gain 2 charges for Gag.

Muffled Moans.effect: Blackmailing a charmed causes them to become seduced - meaning if they try to hint to who you are or do anything non-positive to you, they die, ignoring everything. This does not blackmail them, it only changes charmed -> seduced.

Blinding Desire.effect: Seduced people cannot detect your actions when they involve seducing other people.

Dominatrix.effect: Cannot be seduced, immune to blackmail.

Power Handling.effect: You may pass AA's to other players.

Low-Power Hotwire.effect: You may use a Common AA for free every day, even if it has 0 charges.

Assimilation Copy.effect: If you use Assimilate on someone with immunities, copy them.

Eye of Power.effect: You can see what AA's your allies get in Power Drops and from AA based items.

Loveable.effect: You can be in up to three alliances. Gain 2 luck for neutral allies and +5% coins per ally.

Jack of All Trades.effect: Gain an additional Any Ability from events and items that usually give Any Abilities.

Constantly Evolving.effect: Every time you use an AA you may copy one status immunity from that role, if you don't instead earn 100 coins.

Remove Weakness.effect: At both item rains and power drops you may permanently remove an AA with a charge or spend a charge on your RC to gain an additional random AA.

Throne of Lies.effect: Lies you spread, and lies about you, if believed enough, will become true, you may decide to not get an effect from a lie when it occurs.

Crown of Thorns.effect: If your death is caused by a lie, you may act from the grave and revive easier, and, the person who said the lie that killed you, will have negative lies about them if believed, become true.

Blade of Truth.effect: If something you state that is truth, is thought to be a lie, you may decide on what negatives to inflict upon all who don't believe that fact, or, positive to give yourself/allies/social allies. The more damaging to yourself/allies/social allies the dis-believed truth is, the larger the negative/positive.

Lonesome.effect: When not in an alliance, gain 35% coin boost and +3 luck.

Calming Silence.effect: When not in an alliance, you gain +1 luck every 2 days. You have access to this luck only when alone.

Observant.effect: Observant - When not in an alliance or in an alliance of 2 - You will know whats used on you.

Wolf.effect: When not in alliance or in an alliance of 2, you are protected from attacks and will attack anyone who attacks you. If they are immune to attacks, you learn their role and destroy their inventory.

One Step Ahead.effect: Each day you may select up to two players (you cannot switch to different players after selection). You will know who these players are voting for until after the upcoming Elimination.

Ashes to Ashes.effect: Your items cannot be burnt away/destroyed nor stolen. Anyone you douse is also 'framed' and shown as Arsonist / Evil.

Flamed.effect: Reflect burn, and, every time someone tries to burn you, gain a charge of ignite, and douse them.

Gasoline Fumes.effect: For every doused person, get +10% coins. For every 2 doused people, get +1 luck.

Hellish Landscape.effect: If every living player is doused; remove all burn immunities people have and then inflict everyone with a 12h burn. You also gain a random Epic-Mythical item. You may now also douse corpses.

Heat Vision.effect: You can see who is currently Burned. You also know who is currently doused.

Drinking Buddies.effect: Gain a Beer every time someone else in the game gets a Beer

Alcoholic.effect: Anytime someone tries to inflict you with Drunk, it gets reflected back to them.

Staggering Suggestions.effect: You know who is drunk. People within your alliance can only be the target of positive drunk actions. You can select up to 25% of living players who are not within your alliance to never be the target of positives, and always the target of negatives.
Staggering Suggestions.additionalInfo: You are informed how many people you can pick with the second part of this perk. The player count includes reanimated players and excludes buried alive players.

Backstage Practise.effect: Every time you're visited by someone new, gain a charge for Private Show.

Tips for Tips.effect: Gain 50 coins for every action you stop

Viruses.effect: Spread negative status effects you have upon every successful action stopped. You can decide with up to an hour delay when it is inflicted. You can gain statuses you are immune to, and not be affected by them. Losing the immunity while having the status, will remove the status with it.

Redressing.effect: If a negative status effect or negative action is used on you by someone you're using an original ability on, your ability cancels, you learn this. Their action on you is blocked, despite the cancelling.

Mob Mentality.effect:
The number of marked players the Cultist has grants different bonuses

2 Marked = Coin bonus 10%
3 Marked = Alliance receives a private Item Rain
4 Marked = Given a Cursed Relic (Epic item)
5 Marked = Forbidden Knowledge now works on all marked people and reveals all the marked to the Cultist.
6 Marked = Gain 50% coin Bonus, and a charge of Forbidden Knowledge
7 Marked = You can cure a player of all Status effects once per elimination phase (Unlimited)
8 Marked = You can give a player any negative status effect of choice (basic) once per elimination phase (Unlimited)
9+ Marked = Gain an extra 5% coin bonus for every marked person from this point onwards.

Dark Company.effect: You are immune to Curse. If a player in the Cultist's alliance is marked then they get Curse Immunity as long as they're in this alliance/marked. You may toggle this on/off for yourself/alliance members individually.

Martyr.effect: If all players alive are marked then they all receive Cursed. You can see who cursed are voting, but not who is voting who.

Facade.effect: You may fake your role, alignment, items, immunities, etc

Breakable.effect: Upon taking a lethal attack for the first time, you survive, lose 2 ability charges of choice and lose Facade.

Halo-less.effect: Positive effects on you can be turned into equally powerful negatives, and put on a person of choice.

Forsaken Already.effect: Curses on you act as heals while active. It will not kill you upon its end. Death curses will additionally act as elimination protection till hit/gone.

Spiteful.effect: Upon dying without successfully using Wing Tear - all negatives acquired throughout the game, will be put onto your killer[s] [spread out if voted].

Armoured.effect: Immune to Restrained, Paralysed and Frozen

Preserved.effect: Items cannot be stolen. It will notify anyone who tries to steal them that they had no items.

Spare Cuffs.effect: If someone is inflicted with Restrained, you can use your abilities on them as if they are a prisoner.

Suspicious.effect: If someone in your alliance is investigated they will investigate you instead.

Daylight Robbery.effect: If you are ever in the public vision (abilities, elim, events) and best someone, rob them of half their coins (You can toggle this). If you kill a player who has investigated or harmed you/an ally, take an ability from their RC. Armed Friend can trigger this perk for you.
Daylight Robbery.additionalInfo: For example: If you are placed in a Slaughterer duel, and you win the duel, you would take half of the Slaughterer's coins. If you survive elim, you will take half the coins of whoever died to elim. Cannot copy fake abilities (facade, confusion, etc). May attempt to blindly take an ability, will succeed if the target's actual role has said ability.

Thrill of the Hunt.effect:
Gain a Stack every time somebody dies with your Scent Marker.
1 Stack = Gain +1 Luck.
2 Stacks = Gain a charge for Mask.
3 Stacks = Mask now cures status effects.
4 Stacks = Your vote becomes 2.
5 Stacks = You become immune to attacks.
6 Stacks = First vote against you is null.
7+ Stacks = Gain coins equal to 50 times your stack count.

Background Laughter.effect: If someone puts a negative status on you or an ally, you'll know who did it, and when using Mischief on them, they'll gain the same status back.

Trickster.effect: Upon being investigated in any way shape or form, you will know and can decide to 0 their coin bonuses for next coin phase. Mass invest effects do not activate this.

Money Dump.effect: Any coins people lose due to your abilities, you gain.

Chaotic Nature.effect: You are immune to Despaired and Paralysed

Double Edged Smile.effect: Upon death, pick someone. If you died via elimination and the selected had voted you, double all votes upon them from your original allies and their allies. If you died via an ability/item and the selected is who attacked you, strip them of all positive effects and inflict them with any of your remaining abilities of  choice - using up charges.

Last Laugh.effect: Upon elimination, everyone who voted you will become Despaired. If you got the most votes but survived, they will all become Despaired for the next 24 hours, and remove despair immunity from anyone who had it, permanently - you learn the roles that lost immunity.

Party Trick.effect: If you gain a negative status, you will share it with all visitors while its active on you. You can turn this off.

Loose Noose Lasso.effect: If attacked, redirect it to a random despaired person, if this fails, your killer will become despaired and blackmailed. If immune to these, remove the immunity only.

Power Up.effect: When 85% players are left you get: Cursed immunity, +1 inventory space, +1 item per item rain, and 25% added coin bonus.

Power Up Mega.effect: When 60% players are left you get: Cursed, Frozen & Paralysed immunity, +2 inventory space, +2 items per item rain, 50% added coin bonus and your vote counts as 2. Disables Power Up if active.

Final Gambit.effect: When 30% players are left you get: Immunity to bad status effects, death immunity, +2 inventory space, +2 items per item rain, 50% added coin bonus and your vote counts as 3. Disables Power Up & Power Up Mega if active.

Evil Aura.effect: You get x1.5 higher Immunity Card chances and +2 Luck if everyone in your alliance is not opposite your alignment.

Seize.effect: You'll find out your alliance gets an Immunity Card before everyone else and may choose to take it without anyone knowing.

Abyssal Cursing.effect:
The longer it goes on, the more they suffer:
D0 and D1 statuses can have +-3h variance in when they occur, you choose.
0 Days - Inflict a status of choice [excluding DC/Emp].
1 Day - Inflicted with 2 statuses of choice [^] that they are not immune to, if immune to all, remove 2 immunities.
[Cannot inflict blackmail twice in a row to the same target]
2 Days - Their actions have a 10% chance to effect someone random.
3 Days - They have a ability degraded of their choice. 
4 Days - They have a  perk degraded of their choice. 10% more chance to effect someone random.
5 Days - All abilities, including AAs are degraded.
6 Days - All perks are degraded. 10% more chance to effect someone random.
7 Days - Completely wipe their coins and items. 20% more chance to effect someone random.
8 Days - Their entire role and AAs are disabled. 
9 Days+ - Additional 10% per day to effect someone random.

Abyssal Bound.effect: Abyss curse victims cannot vote you from Day 2+.

Phantom's Grasp.effect: If you die, all abyssal curses will stop functioning, but will come back if you are revived.

Abyssal Shadow.effect: You may gain the investigation results of an abyssal cursed person of choice.

Abusive.effect: If someone uses a negative item on you more than once, inflict paralysis and burn on them, along with finding out their identity.

Corruption.effect: Each time you save someone with your abilities, gain +3 luck. Each time your abilities assist in killing someone, gain +30% coins.

Watchful Eye.effect: The second time and onwards somebody votes for you; you will be told their identity after the elimination.

Freakish Nature.effect: Your non-aligned allies do not gain any luck in your alliance, you instead have theirs added to yours. This is added before your own lucky/unlucky but after their lucky/unlucky/perk calculations.

Blood Luster.effect: Killing items cannot kill you when you use them, and can be manipulated by you to a degree.

Body Count.effect: Each time you murder someone / are the main cause of someone dying, gain an immunity of choice immediately, including 1 time elim immunity which lasts till hit. Also gain a 30% coin bonus.

Dealer.effect: Allows you to transfer coins to somebody. Anyone in the Threatener's alliance can also transfer money to each other. The Threatener can choose who within the alliance can do this.

Insane.effect: You cannot become Despaired, Drunk or Blackmailed.

Magic Mind.effect: Your actions and votes cannot be controlled by anyone or anything.

Executioner's Blade.effect: While alive, every elimination is a double elimination, but the 2nd elimination will have candidates put up for you to pick from, based on terms you put up at day start. You do not need to kill someone.

Pen & Blade.effect: You may not vote, you learn who is voting you. You survive one elimination. You may publicly reveal who voted you upon your death.

Intimidating Aura.effect: You may join alliances, not taking up a slot. You increase immunity card chances by 1.25, but you decide who gets it, based on whom in the alliance is top of the previous requirement (top 50% of alliance).

Bribery Benefits.effect:
Your vote is worth 2, you may vote 3 times, but only with whoever gave you the most in:
Money (coin total)
Items (based on value)
Abilities (based on positiveness/rarity)
People may hand you money and aas freely. Draws mean neither get it, and every new day the totals are reset.

Many Wares.effect: You have infinite inventory space. You gain 2 items every day and start with 6 items. Your luck is randomly between 5-15 every time it is rolled.

Cargo Cart.effect: You may join multiple alliances not taking a slot. Alliance members have -25% luck but gain 1-2 additional items in item rains, and -50% luck in power drops but gain an additional aa.

Banker's Jeaolusy.effect: While alive all shop items cost 10% more. You may make 2 items you have cost 25% more.

Relentless Spirits.effect: While this Traveller is active, the dead may act on dead as if both players were alive, and statuses and effects work as if they're alive.

Fetch me their Souls.effect: While this traveller is alive, every day the dead will have the opportunity to vote on one dead player to send to the Reaper (TD), and every second day they may vote on a dead player to revive alongside the first vote.

Undead Resilience.effect: The first time you would die by elimination and by an attack, you will resist it.

Grim Resolve.effect: You can only vote if voted, and you vote in all possible voting pools. Your vote power is 3. You will be told if you may vote.

Life & Death.effect: Dead may form alliances. Alliances you join may have an additional 2 players, and may invite dead / living to them. Communications are allowed within the alliance. You may join 2 alliances.

Cold Benevolance.effect: Infinite inventory, any items and aas this role gains from drops are instead given as rewards to the revived player from the revival voting pool. This role cannot use items or aas gained by drops, but can if they are handed to them.

Harbringer.effect: This role is immortal until 5 players die. Perks also activate at 5 players dead.

Ethereal Presence.effect: May talk in dead and living chat, ignoring any restrictions present - even after death.

Obviously a Ball.effect: You cannot obtain investigation immunity in any way.

Uncontrollable.effect: Once you have used bouncing, your actions cannot be redirected or blocked in any way.
